sect1.title: Installation
sect1.para: Before we can begin programming, we need to install GTK and Vala, along with their dependencies.

sect2.title: Installing GTK+.
sect2.para: You may install GTK+ and its various dependencies from source by downloading several archives, untarring them and running ./configure, ./make and ./make to install them.

However, if you're using a Linux distribution with a package manager, it is better to install the precompiled packages from the distribution's repositories as it would be easier and afterward, the packages would receive security updates and any other upgrades as they are rolled out by the distribution.

You need to install the -dev packages that contain the header files and static libraries that are needed to compile GTK+ applications. Installing the GTK+ development package will also install all its dependecies (the header files for GLib, gdk-pixbuf, etc).

sect2.title: Installing Vala
